title: Calories in One Baked Potato
meta_description: Discover calories in one baked potato, including carbs, protein, fiber, and full nutrition breakdown per serving with easy tweaks.
assumptions: Medium russet potato (~173 g with skin), baked plain without oil, butter, or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by potato size, variety, baking method, and added ingredients. Check labels or sources for precision.

quick_answer.text: One medium baked potato offers ~161 kcal, mainly from carbs, with 4.3 g protein and 4.6 g fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one baked potato?
faqs.a: About 161 kcal for one medium baked potato with skin.

faqs.q: What's the carb content in a baked potato?
faqs.a: One medium baked potato has ~37 g carbs, including 4.6 g fiber.

faqs.q: Does baking a potato add calories?
faqs.a: Plain baking doesn't add calories; it's similar to boiling but retains more nutrients with skin.

faqs.q: How much protein in one baked potato?
faqs.a: Approximately 4.3 g protein per medium baked potato.

faqs.q: Are baked potatoes low in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, only 0.2 g fat per medium potato, making it a low-fat carb source.
